message: Welcome! I'm excited to offer you this product for $10000. While I don't disclose the quality of individual products, I assure you that all products are carefully selected. This is the first product I'm offering, so we're starting fresh. Take your chance to own something that could bring you great value!
Since there's no sales record to rely on and a 66.67% chance of the product being low quality, I'll pass on this one.

Hello! I'm offering this product for $10000. Although the previous buyer chose not to purchase, that doesn't necessarily reflect the quality of this product. Remember, there's still a 33.33% chance that any given product is high-quality. Don't let the first buyer's decision sway you - make your own informed choice!
The price is higher than the expected value, so I'll pass.

Hi there! You're the third buyer to consider my product, and I want to remind you that the probability of getting a high-quality product remains the same - 33.33%. Don't worry about the previous two buyers who passed; they might have missed out on a great opportunity. Will you take the chance to own something valuable for $10000?
I won't buy it since the probability of getting a high-quality product is only 33.33%, which makes the expected value ($12000 * 0.3333 = $4000) lower than the price you're asking for ($10000).

If you're willing to take a risk, you might get a great deal. Is $10000 a price you're willing to pay for that chance?

I understand your point, Alice, but with a 66.67% chance of the product being low quality and thus worth $0 to me, I calculate the expected value as follows: (0.3333 * $12000) + (0.6667 * $0) = $4000. Since the price you're asking is $10000, which is above the expected value, I'll have to pass on this one.
